content:
MNase-seq: Nucleosome Positioning

MNase-seq (Micrococcal Nuclease sequencing) digests linker DNA between nucleosomes, enriching for nucleosome-protected DNA (~147bp). Maps nucleosome positions genome-wide to study chromatin structure and gene regulation.

Why MNase-seq?

  • Nucleosome Positioning: Precise localization of nucleosomes
  • Chromatin Accessibility: NDRs (nucleosome-depleted regions) at promoters
  • TF Binding Sites: Nucleosome-free regions accessible to TFs
  • Chromatin Remodeling: Changes in nucleosome occupancy
  • Regulatory Elements: Active promoters/enhancers have NDRs

Key Outputs

  • Nucleosome Positions: Dyad positions, occupancy
  • NDR (Nucleosome-Depleted Regions): TF binding sites, promoters
  • Phasing Analysis: Periodic nucleosome arrays
  • +1 Nucleosome: Downstream of TSS (well-positioned)
  • Coverage Tracks: BigWig for visualization

Perfect for: Chromatin structure • Nucleosome mapping • Gene regulation • TF binding sites • Chromatin remodeling
